results.title: Masterpieces from the Louvre: bronze sculptures from France
results.creator_credit: Bob Mclean, Caroline Turner, David Burnett, Nine Network (Australia) and QAG
results.brief_description: In 1988, in conjunction with EXPO, a series of bronze sculptures and paintings, considered masterpieces of French art from the 16th-19th centuries, and which are housed at the Louvre, were exhibited at the Queensland Art Gallery. This video is a potted art history from the Renaissance to Rodin. It looks at famous patrons such as Louis XIV, the Sun King; well regarded artists and sculptors of the time; and gives a brief explanation of the key movements in Art History during that time.

results.title: Mastering Your Microwave
results.brief_description: Many new microwave owners experience great frustration when trying to learn the techniques and principles of microwave cooking. They often feel they will never master the art. The “Mastering Your Microwave” video cookbook collection has been produced by international microwave consultant, Joan McDermott, to help overcome these problems. Everyday recipes including roast meats, souffles, vegetables and fish are included on this video. Rated: G

results.title: Massive Attack: eleven promos
results.brief_description: The pioneering force behind the rise of trip-hop, British band Massive Attack were among the most innovative and influential groups of their generation, renowned for their talents at combining the sounds of hip hop rhythms, soulful melodies, dub grooves and choice samples. Their music is hypnotic, cinematic (in fact their music has featured on numerous soundtracks) and frequently political, addressing the inequities of society and the perilous state of mankind. This disc features eleven film clips, ranging from 1990-98, and includes: Daydreaming (Dir: Billie Walsh, 1990) ; Unfinished sympathy (Dir: Billie Walsh, 1991) ; Safe from harm (Dir: Billie Walsh, 1991) ; Be thankful for what you’ve got (Dir: Billie Walsh, 1992) ; Sly (Dir: Stephane Sednaoui, 1994) ; Protection (Dir: Michel Gondry, 1995) ; Karmacoma (Dir: Jonathan Glazer, 1995) ; Risingson (Dir: Walter Stern, 1997) ; Teardrop (Dir: Billie Walsh, 1990) ; Angel (Dir: Walter Stern, 1998) ; Inertia Creeps (Dir: Wiz, 1998). The clips range in technique, some, like “Inertia Creeps”, are stylish and conceptual, others such as “Safe from harm” and “Unfinished sympathy” are notable for their location (a disused tower block, East London and Peico Avenue, Los Angeles respectively), simple in execution, and succeed in commenting on the social milieu in which they are set.

results.title: Massage for Health
results.creator_credit: Johanna Demetrakas, Steven Adams and Healing Arts Home Video
results.brief_description: You can take the fitness of your mind and body into your own hands with “Massage for Health”. You can combat stress, enhance your physical beauty, or improve your athletic performance. They’ll cover every aspect of massage as they cover virtually every inch of your body. You’ll learn the safe, and correct way to prepare for, and give, and receive massage. With a little practice this video will give you all you need to experience new levels of strength, relaxation and well being.

results.title: Mass spectrometry
results.creator_credit: Mallory Pearce, James L. Sudmeier, Robert L Pescok, Communications Group West and John Wiley and Sons
results.brief_description: Presents the technique of mass spectrometry, shows how the instrument operates, how a mass spectrum is obtained, the relationship between precise molecular weight and the chemical formula, and some of the common ways in which molecules fragment. Intended for classes in analytical and organic chemistry.

results.title: Masquerade
results.creator_credit: Co Hoedeman, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The magical fingers of master animator Co Hoedeman, whose film The Sand Castle won an Oscar in 1979, has created yet another world of piquant creatures. Papier mache puppets ride machines and manipulate robots strange to the human eye. A great masquerade is in the planning, and the air crackles with excitement. Plunged into the joys and frustrations of creating costumes, the zealous puppets produce a bumper crop, each one more elaborate than the last. The film illustrates the creative process, with its inevitable pitfalls and rewards. It says that to create is to be alive.

results.title: No act of God...
results.creator_credit: Ian Ball, Sidney Goldsmith, Andy Thomson, Rupert Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The world is running low on cheap fossil fuels. To the question What else is there?” many scientists have answered, “nuclear power. But some physicists, as well as energy analysts, government consultants, and even law enforcement agencies, are alarmed by the proliferation of nuclear reactors. This film explains various experts’ concerns, among them Dr. Hannes Alfven, Nobel prize-winning physicist. He no longer supports nuclear power, and states most determinedly, “No act of God is permitted.”

results.title: Ninja scroll (D)
results.creator_credit: Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Haruo Sai, Masaki Sawanobori, Shigeaki Komatsu, JVC, Movic and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: Feudal Japan - a time of danger, intrigue and deception. Jubei is a masterless ninja who travels the land alone, hiring his services to those with gold or a worthy cause. An evil conspiracy is at work to overthrow the Government. Jubei reluctantly joins forces with a mysterious old man and the beautiful but tragic Kagero, in an effort to defeat the Shogun of the dark and his demonic cronies. Not surprisingly this is a struggle that involves huge amounts of action, violence, bloodletting, sex, supernatural powers and transmogrification. The animation is an impressive though slightly incongruous blend of detailed architecture, evocative landscape and highly stylized action figures. It will also interest followers of popular culture. Citizens Award Winner, 1993 Yubari City International Adventure Fantastic Film Festival. PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS ANIMATED FILM HAS AN ‘R’ RATING FOR PERSONS OVER THE AGE OF 18 DUE TO THE EXPLICIT VIOLENT AND SEXUAL NATURE OF ITS CONTENT.

results.title: Nineteen Eighty-Four
results.creator_credit: Michael Radford, Simon Perry, Rosenblum Productions, Umbrella Entertainment and Virgin
results.brief_description: A bleak view of a totalitarian future that is visually faithful to the famous novel by George Orwell. John Hurt stars as Winston Smith, the man who revolts against “The Party’s” rules on correct actions, words, gestures and thoughts. Also stars Richard Burton in his last screen role, Suzanna Hamilton, Cyril Cusack and Gregor Fisher. Music score is by Eurythmics and Dominic Muldowney.

results.title: Just an idea
results.creator_credit: Guy Blanchard, James Mellor, Central Office of Information and Editorial Film Productions
results.brief_description: The many sources of technical information available to British industry, including research associations, technical libraries, and the constituent organisations of the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research. The film illustrates how the owner of an engineering firm solves a production problem with the help of valuable technical information obtained from these sources.
